ProjectTitle: Autonomous diagnostics by combining 3D printed passive pumps and conventional microfluidics
InitialFeedbackHistory:
22/06/2022
2. Data: if you have physical samples or models you can also describe these in the table. You can describe your protocols, sops and notebooks better under documentation and you don't have to mention presentations and posters. 
4. Metadata: Are your instruments generating metadata, for example with your images? 
5. Are you using a professional dropbox account? KU Leuven also offers a 2TB onedrive that may be more secure, see https://admin.kuleuven.be/icts/services/onedrive for more information 
6. Preservation: please note that the KU Leuven RDM policy recommends 10 years of data preservation (www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/policy)
7. Sharing: Have you considered any specific data repositories? You can share your data in KU Leuven RDR (https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr) or use domain specific repositories, f1000 research gives good recommendations https://f1000research.com/for-authors/data-guidelines
